translator_notes: 红楼梦 (Hónglóumèng) literally 'Dream of Red Mansions/Chambers' - one of China's Four Great Classical Novels
脂评 refers to commentary by 脂砚斋 (Zhiyan Zhai), believed to be someone close to the author, possibly a female relative
汇校本 indicates this is a collated edition combining multiple manuscript sources to present the most authentic text
曹雪芹 (Cao Xueqin, c. 1715-1763/4) was a Qing Dynasty writer who spent a decade writing this semi-autobiographical masterpiece
The cover illustration shows a classical beauty (仕女) under plum blossoms - a traditional motif often associated with Lin Daiyu's poetic nature
research_notes: The 脂评汇校本 is distinct from the 120-chapter Cheng-Gao edition; it preserves only the 80 chapters authored by Cao Xueqin with original commentary
Zhiyan Zhai's identity remains scholarly debated - some believe it was Cao Xueqin's wife or female relative
This edition compiled by Kolistan incorporates readings from 甲戌本, 庚辰本, 己卯本, and other manuscripts
